009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
013import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
014import imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant;
015
016import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
017
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This class implements the CIELuv color space. See Sec. 14.2 of [1] for additional details. All component values are
022 * assumed to be in [0,1]. Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ coordinates, i.e.,
023 * without conversion to Java's D50-based profile connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return
024 * D50-based XYZ coordinates in Java's profile connection space. This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
025 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/09/01
034 */
035@SuppressWarnings("serial")
036public class LuvColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
037        private static final sRgbColorSpace srgbCS = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
038        private static final LuvColorSpace instance = new LuvColorSpace();
039        
040        public static LuvColorSpace getInstance() {
041                return instance;
042        }
043                
044        // D65 reference white point:
045        private static final double[] XYZref = StandardIlluminant.D65.getXYZ();
046        private static final double uuref = fu(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // u'_n
047        private static final double vvref = fv(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // v'_n
048        
049        // chromatic adaptation objects:
050        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D65, StandardIlluminant.D50);
051        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D50, StandardIlluminant.D65);
052        
053        /** Constructor (non-public). */
054        private LuvColorSpace() {
055                super(TYPE_Luv,3);
056        }
057        
058        // XYZ50->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D50)
059        @Override
060        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
061                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
062                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
063        }
064        
065        // XYZ65->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D65)
066        @Override
067        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {    
068                double X = XYZ65[0];
069                double Y = XYZ65[1];    
070                double Z = XYZ65[2];
071                double YY = f1(Y / XYZref[1]);          // Y'
072                double uu = fu(X,Y,Z);          // u'
073                double vv = fv(X,Y,Z);          // v'
074                double L = (116.0 * YY - 16.0);                 //L*
075                double u = (13 * L * (uu - uuref));     //u*
076                double v = (13 * L * (vv - vvref));     //v*
077                return new float[] {(float)L, (float)u, (float)v};
078        }
079        
080        // CIELab->XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Luv
081        @Override
082        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Luv) {
083                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
084                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
085        }
086        
087        // CIELab->XYZ65
088        @Override
089        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Luv) {
090                double L = Luv[0];
091                double u = Luv[1];
092                double v = Luv[2];
093                double Y = XYZref[1] * f2((L + 16) / 116.0);
094                double uu = (L < 0.00001) ? uuref : u / (13 * L) + uuref; // u'
095                double vv = (L < 0.00001) ? vvref : v / (13 * L) + vvref; // v'
096                double X = Y * ((9*uu)/(4*vv));
097                double Z = Y * ((12 - 3 * uu - 20 * vv) / (4 * vv));
098                return new float[] {(float)X, (float)Y, (float)Z};
099        }
100        
101        //sRGB -> CIELuv
102        @Override
103        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
104                float[] XYZ65 = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ65(srgb);
105                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
106        }
107        
108        //CIELuv -> sRGB
109        @Override
110        public float[] toRGB(float[] Luv) {
111                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
112                float[] srgb = srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
113                return srgb;
114        }
115        
116        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
117        
118        private static final double Epsilon = 216.0/24389;
119        private static final double Kappa = 841.0/108;
120        
121        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
122        private double f1 (double c) {
123                return (c > Epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (Kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
124        }
125        
126        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
127        private double f2 (double c) {
128                final double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
129                return (c3 > Epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / Kappa;
130        }
131        
132        private static double fu (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
133                // fails if 0.001 is used!
134                return (X < 0.00001) ? 0 : (4 * X) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
135        }
136        
137        private static double fv (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
138                return (Y < 0.00001) ? 0 : (9 * Y) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
139        }
140
141}
